targetExampleSentences: I spoke without thinking.
Give us some time to think about it.
nativeExampleSentences: I spoke without thinking.
Give us some time to think about it.

targetExampleSentences: I don't want to think of what may have happened.
nativeExampleSentences: I don't want to think of what may have happened.

targetExampleSentences: Are you thinking of quitting your job?
nativeExampleSentences: Are you thinking of quitting your job?

targetExampleSentences: Can you think of a better solution?
nativeExampleSentences: Can you think of a better solution?

targetExampleSentences: We've been thinking of you a lot.
I can't think of how many cases he solved in the past.
nativeExampleSentences: We've been thinking of you a lot.
I can't think of how many cases he solved in the past.

targetExampleSentences: That's the only thing that's going to change, I think.
nativeExampleSentences: That's the only thing that's going to change, I think.

translations: (to have an opinion; often used with "of" and "about")
targetExampleSentences: Tell me what you think about the issue.
We think highly of her.
nativeExampleSentences: Tell me what you think about the issue.
We think highly of her.

targetExampleSentences: You never think of other people's feelings.
Before buying a car, you must think of the expense it entails.
nativeExampleSentences: You never think of other people's feelings.
Before buying a car, you must think of the expense it entails.

targetExampleSentences: Think of a number and a color.
nativeExampleSentences: Think of a number and a color.

targetExampleSentences: Think what the chances are of that happening.
nativeExampleSentences: Think what the chances are of that happening.

targetExampleSentences: Think how different things would be if you had never met him.
nativeExampleSentences: Think how different things would be if you had never met him.

targetExampleSentences: I didn't think to bring some water.
nativeExampleSentences: I didn't think to bring some water.

targetExampleSentences: I'm trying to think what I ate yesterday.
nativeExampleSentences: I'm trying to think what I ate yesterday.

targetExampleSentences: Is he coming to the party? - I think so.
nativeExampleSentences: Is he coming to the party? - I think so.

targetExampleSentences: I have to do what I think is in the best interest of my children.
I don't think it's a very good idea.
nativeExampleSentences: I have to do what I think is in the best interest of my children.
I don't think it's a very good idea.

targetExampleSentences: I thought we'd meet again.
nativeExampleSentences: I thought we'd meet again.

targetExampleSentences: After having a bit of a think, he decided to move on.
nativeExampleSentences: After having a bit of a think, he decided to move on.
